messages: e75bae18d98f39ddf91395da29c6f1ad (14:29): hey guys, just used geolocation api for first time, was wondering if there was a way i could extract country from the position, so far i've just used latitude/longitude and redirected to google maps, but i'd like to know the country and then display a flag (just for learning purposes)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:31): you'd either need to get some geodata from somewhere so you can compute it yourself
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:31): or find an HTTP API that does it for you
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:31): geolocation v2 might handle this automatically
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (14:32): eyes tomshardware article @ http://www.tomshardware.com/news/ie9-chrome-firefox-safari-opera,11574.html

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:34): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, that might work, so long as you're not trying to figure out which country some point in a disputed region belongs to. That would just be a political nightmare to deal with.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, something else...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, people told you me you said something about about URLs and did not follow up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, can you fix that?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, you are removing my reasons to yell at the IETF
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, well, limiting for certain topics :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:37): oh, right, probably about the about: URI scheme
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:38): I need to follow up on that one day. It's just low priority

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, I was told there are certain outstanding issues that need minor edits after which the draft needs to be submitted again to make it all work
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, that is what I said
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, if you are busy please tell them that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, because they can find someone else to do it
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:39): I'll do it. It wasn't too much that was needed.
8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e (14:46): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: You're not at TPAC, right?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:47): nope
8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e (14:48): kk.  I was hoping to discharge my debt.  ^_^
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:48): 8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e, yeah, unfortunately I wasn't allowed to go.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:48): thanks for reminding me about your debt though! :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:49): how much was it anyway? About 200Kr or something?
8798deca92af07eccdb21a777058f42e (14:49): Yah, about a dinner worth.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:51): ok, nevermind. I'm sure you'll make it up to me one day. Maybe TPAC next year.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:51): or maybe just pay it forward to Anne or something
e75bae18d98f39ddf91395da29c6f1ad (14:52): i'm trying to use google maps api but i don't know what i'm doing wrong, could you help please.. http://www.webdevout.net/test?02g
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:02): I wonder how many mimetypes are deployed and not described, same thing for protocol schemes.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:04): I'm thinking about things like "webcal:" (Apple ¬Æ)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (15:07): well, depends on what counts as "described"
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:09): heh. indeed. described could be a spec somewhere at a URI or in IETF space. Let say that I had in mind described at IETF
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (15:10): if you mean registered in the appropriate registry, then a whole host of MIME types and URI schemes in common use are not registered
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:11): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URI_scheme#Unofficial_but_common_URI_schemes
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:12): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mime_type#List_of_common_media_types
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:14): ah and some are grouped in some IETF RFCs such as application/svg+xml http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3023#section-8.19
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:14): content type has yet been registered for SVG and so this media type
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:14): should not be used until such registration has been completed."
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:18): sees that this has never been answered http://www.ietf.org/mail-archive/web/ietf-types/current/msg00999.html
